availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fort Bragg is Military outpost located in Mendocino County, California. The military base was founded in 1857 by 1st Lt. Horatio G. Gibson. It was named after Gibson’s commanding officer Braxton Bragg. It was located just north of the Noyo River and on the coast of the Pacific Ocean.

bibl.p: “Fort Bragg Until the 20th Century,” Fort Bragg: On California’s Spectacular Mendocino Coast, http://city.fortbragg.com/348/Fort-Bragg-Until-the-20th-Century; “Fort Bragg: Historical Landmark,” California Office of Historic Preservation, http://ohp.parks.ca.gov/ListedResources/Detail/615
